grading_methodology: New 5-axis scoring replacing Cycle 5's tactical axes. Each axis 0-100, weighted: Economic Force Magnitude (35%), Structural Compounding (25%), Convergence Resistance (20%), Timing Structural Fit (10%), Capital Efficiency (10%). Corrects Cycle 5 Error 2: scores STRUCTURAL DURABILITY, not tactical accessibility.

economic_force_magnitude.description: TAM x cost advantage ratio x Jevons expansion potential. A $200B market with 15x cost advantage is more powerful than a $1B market with 3x advantage.

structural_compounding.description: Does this business get HARDER to compete with over time? Data flywheel, network effects, physical asset accumulation, regulatory knowledge base, customer lock-in.

convergence_resistance.description: What prevents competitors from replicating this in 3 years? Physical assets, licenses, data, regulations, relationships, brand trust. Low competition today is NOT convergence resistance.

timing_structural_fit.description: Is there a structural reason why NOW? Specific regulation deadline, demographic cliff, technology threshold just crossed, asset prices depressed, financing window open.

capital_efficiency.description: Ratio of structural advantage gained per dollar invested. A $2M acquisition creating $500K/yr structural advantage vs a $5M SaaS build creating the same.

note: All 32 signals scored 4+ and forwarded. Signals are graded at the FORCE level, not the model level. Model-level scoring happens after Agent B construction.
